title: Calories in Chicken Stock
meta_description: Discover calories in chicken stock per cup, including full nutrition breakdown, sodium levels, and variations for low-sodium or homemade options.
assumptions: Store-bought chicken stock, reduced-fat; 1 cup = 240 ml serving; no added ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, homemade vs. store-bought, sodium content, and preparation; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup (240 ml) of chicken stock contains about 12 calories and is very low in fat and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Homemade with bones and veggies (richer flavor)

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of chicken stock?
faqs.a: About 12 calories for 240 ml of standard chicken stock.

faqs.q: Is chicken stock high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 960 mg per cup; opt for low-sodium versions to reduce intake.

faqs.q: What's the protein in chicken stock?
faqs.a: Around 1.2 g per 240 ml cup, providing minimal protein.

faqs.q: Does homemade chicken stock have more calories?
faqs.a: It can vary; homemade often has 5-10 more calories per cup due to natural fats and ingredients.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in chicken stock?
faqs.a: Very few, about 1.2 g per cup, mostly from any added vegetables or seasonings.
